messages.subject: INTERESTED
messages.body:
Dear Mr Ashawo,

I am a bit surprised that you managed to find me, as
well as the fact that I am an Elbonian citizen.  That
information was not publicly available, as far as I
knew.  Did you go to the consulate homepage by any
chance?  I am just curious.

In any case, I am glad that you contacted me.  Your
proposal sounds interesting.  However, as a retired
businessman, I have learned to be a bit cautious. 
Please send me more information about this business
and the modalities that you must have perfected by
now.



Sincerely,

Juan Perez Munoz de Baratta Tudela Loveday

messages.subject: Good day
messages.body:
Dear Partner,
Thanks for your urgent response to my mail.I really
appreciate it.It really gives me the impression that
i have found the right partner.

I wonder if you have ever been in a joint venture
business with someone.if you have , you will agree
with me that unless both parties involved work in
perfect harmony and rhythm, the joint venture would
fail.
And to achieve this rhythm requires mutual trust.

I am a very respectable lawyer working in the most
important sector of my nation's economy.There's no
way i'm going to involve myself in this kind of deal
with the 100% chance of success.

There no way i can retrieve the money from the
security company or the local bank either without
the assistance of a trusted foreign partner.So i am
willing to develop a mutually beneficial and
financial relationship with you.

Let me give you a little briefing of the entire set
up.I am the lawyer of the deceased.i have a copy of
the will made by the deceased some years before his
death, then he was still single.
i intend to falsify this will in your favor ,to
reflect you as the NEXT OF KIN.
The security company has already notified me that as
soon as the NEXT OF KIN is produced.The consignment
belonging to the deceased would be released onto the
NEXT OF KIN which is consistent with their policy. 

As for the money in the local bank.I believe this
would even be more easier to collect.
The N.N.P.C has directed the local bank to deposit
the money in a suspended account in the Central bank
of Nigeria.This has been done.
The CBN has since been in search of the NEXT OF KIN
of the deceased. 

I have been invited to a meeting with some officials
of the (CBN).I am supposed to introduce to them the
NEXT OF KIN of the deceased.This is were you now
come in.
I will present you to them and will act as your
lawyer to ensure the safe transfer of the funds into
your nominated account.


Mr Juan Perez ,please let me know if i have your
full cooperation on this venture.This is the path to
my financial freedom which i have always dreamed
about.If you are not 100% committed to this ,PLEASE
BACK DOWN NOW....


I still have not decided to give you more info on
the deceased, because we have not yet ascertained if
we will be working together on this.

I would need scanned copies of an internationally
acceptable ID from you like your drivers license or
the photo page of your international passport.

you can reach me on my mobile phone; 234 804 210
2848

Please always send me email via this my yahoo email
account as i seem to be having problems with me
tiscali email due to poor Internet connection speed.

I look forward to your favorable response.

Best regards,

Barr. Jacob Ashawo

messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

Thanks for your trust.  I agree with you, the only way
to carry forward a successful partnership is to be
able to trust the other party.  

Please be assured that I will not disappoint you.  I
am an honest person, with very high moral standards.

This said, please go ahead and falsify the will in my
favor.  I will do whatever is in my power for this
deal to succeed:  25% of the proceedings sounds like a
very strong incentive.

One quick question before I commit myself fully:  you
mentioned introducing me to the CBN officials.  Does
this mean that I will need to travel to Nigeria?  It
is not a problem, but if that is the case, I should
probably start by renewing my passport and making some
travel arrangements.

Again, you have my full cooperation in this venture. 
I expect your response.

Sincerely,

Juan

messages.subject: We proceed
messages.body:
Dear partner,
I have eagerly awaited your email and i'm glad you
finally replied.
i do believe that we can proceed on this joint
venture.
Before i proceed, i would want to put us on some
form of codes, whenever i call you before i begin to
speak on the transaction, i will ask you for a
password which would be FULFILLMENT.
You too should do the same whenever you call.This is
to avoid crossed lines due to poor communications
network and to maintain a high level of security.
I would need your phone and fax numbers.
I would also need your personal data as in date of
birth and place of birth.
this is to enable me prepare the WILL.Immediately
the will is completed i will have it duly registered
at the STATE PROBATE REGISTRY, in your name.
You might be required to come down to Nigeria to
complete the transaction but i think that that is
very unlikely because, I can legally represent you
and have the money transfered to your nominated bank
account.
I was suppose to hold a meeting at  with the CBN
officials today the 24th of sept. But the meeting
had to be postponed. Currently i'm in an offshore
facility.I'm out of the coverage area of my mobile
phone operator and i'm rather reluctant to use any
facility of the corporation other than email for
this transaction.I will be back in Lagos by next
week.By next week i will hold the meeting with the
CBN officials when i get home.
After the meeting ( If all goes well, we would begin
the transfer).
I don't see us having any problem with the security
company.Their office is in the Netherlands and you
would have to make arrangements to travel to the
Netherlands.
Before i go.The name of the deceased is Mr Cleaves
Brown.
I am still expecting the scanned copy of the
international passport.I advise you renew your
passport.I need the scanned copy really soon.so i
know we are both fully committed to having this
business succeed.
Please send me all the info i requested.

Best regards,
Barr Jacob Ashawo

messages.subject: Let's go
messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

I believe your code system is a great idea.  We should
implement it also whenever we email each other.  From
now on, we should include a reference code word in our
messages.  I suggest the word , which will
identify them as legitimate emails.

Here is my personal information:

Juan Perez Munoz de Baratta Tudela Loveday
Birthdate:  Dec 12, 1935
Place:  NarvaHiiumaa Island, Elbonia

I mailed my passport to the consulate this morning in
order to renew it.  This proceeding can take two to
three weeks, I hope this puts un within our timeframe.
 I will scan it and send to you as soon as I receive
it, I did not think you would need an expired
passport.

Cleaves Brown, you said?  does not ring a bell.  Brown
is a pretty common Elbonian surname, though.  Do you
know by any chance what part of the country he was
from?  

Please let me know if there is anything else I can do
at this point.

Sincerely,

Juan

messages.subject: SUBLIMINABLE
messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

Sorry for the late response.  I went to the consulate
to get my passport and make a copy to send you, but
they had already sent it to Elbonia for renewal. 
However, I am sending you my current drivers license,
I hope it helps you.

I thought I mentioned this to you before, but I must
have missed it:  I cannot use phones now.  I started
losing my hearing when I turned 65, and now I am
almost completely deaf.  We will have to use email to
communicate, which is more secure anyway.

Please go ahead and send me the documents, and do not
hesitate to tell me if you need anything else.

Also, can you confirm whether or not I need to travel
overseas, either to Nigeria or the Netherlands?  I'd
like to start making preparations right away.

Regards,

Juan

messages.subject: SUBLIMINABLE
messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

I am a little bit concerned about your lack of
commitment to this business.  This is the second time
you miss a critical appointment with the CBN
officials.  If you keep blowing them off, we may lose
their cooperation, don't you think?  Please reschedule
it as soon as possible, and let me know what comes out
of it.

As for the consignment, I am confused:  how much money
do we have?  first you told me there was a balance of
12.5 million, and now you mention 25 million.  Look, I
am a honest person who plays by the rules, and I
expect my partners to do the same thing.  I will only
do business with people I have full confidence in, and
I thought I could trust you.  Please do not betray me.

I am ready to travel as soon as I get my passport
back.  I will contact Morgan, but first I would like
for you to clarify the amount of money involved. 
Also, how much does the security company know?  do I
tell them about the money or just refer to a
consignment?  I have never done anything like this
before, so you will have to explain me the detailed
modalities and guide me through the process.  I know
you'll be patient with an old man.

I look forward to your response, 

Juan

Dear friend & partner,
Sorry for the temporal break in communication.
I have not been able to access my email due to
security reasons,
i was part of the negotiating team between the
federal govt. of Nigeria and the Nigerian labor
congress.There was an impending strike action.
But thank God that is over, at least for now.
The meeting had been deadlocked for days, during
which time i was not able to access my email mainly
as a security precaution.
I did not see the copy of the mail you sent to the
security company until now.
I must say that i need to have my eyes or head
examined because i only noticed that the email
address of the security company is not correct.The
correct email is :
continentsecurities2003@yahoo.co.uk

it seems i forget the 2003.
Please i know it seems stupid that i could make such
a mistake but please take it easy.

I appreciate your sending me a copy of the mail, i
would insist that you continue to do so.

The machinery in the local bank is already in
motion.A staff of the CBN is working with me to
expedite action.
we have a meeting tomorrow,
that is when i will hand over to him the necessary
paper work.
I will also send you the documents as soon as i can.

If i don't get a fax number from you, i would send
them via email.

Hope you like the photo, 
That was me, My wife Melissa and the kids.

I apologize for once again stalling the progress of
our project.Lets not dwell on it but rather look
forward to the successful conclusion.

The will has been duly registered, it cost me
350,000 naira ($2500 or there about).
But we can be rest assured that we would not have
any problems as regards that.

I will always keep in touch.

Thanks for being there for me .
Barr, Jacob Ashawo

really came from you.  Please resend the address using

Dear Jacob,

You can raise as many eyebrows as you want, but I
suggest you read carefully my message before making
that type of comments.  I never said I cannot get a
fax.  A fax machine costs 100 dollars, and can be
plugged into any phone line.  What I said is that I do
not have a SECURED fax line yet.  I cannot just risk
leaving confidential faxes laying around fo anybody to
read.   For that reason, I insist that you email me
the documents, since nobody but me has access to this
email account.  Any questions?

You still have not answered my question:  how are we
going to get the money for the demurrage (by the way,
that is the correct word) charges?  Unless you have
already thought a way to raise that amount, we will
have to pull our resources together.  I am open to
suggestions.  Like you said, nobody can accuse me of
not being serious and commited to this business.

I will answer the securities company as soon as I hear
what you have to say.

Regards,

Juan

messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

This is a big change in our plans.  I have given this
new development a lot of thought, and I have good news
and bad news for you, and bad news for your
associates.

The good news is, I may be able to raise most of the
required amount, perhaps the whole sum.  My family
owns some very valuable old paintings, including the
only existing copy of the Mona Lisa, and I can
probably borrow some money out of them.

The bad news for us is, I will have to travel to
Elbonia to make the arrangements, and this will delay
our business for a couple of weeks.  I need to find a
suitable investor, contact the Louvre and tell them
the bad news, and go to Amsterdam from there.

Tha bad news for your partners is: this will cost
money.  Since I am now financing the operation, I will
expect a higher part of the funds.  I require my
participation to increase to 40%.  Discuss this with
them.

Please let me know your decision as soon as possible. 
According to the consulate, my passport has already
been sent back, and I should receive it on Monday.  If
you agree to my conditions, I will start making travel
arrangements right away.

Looking forward to your SUBLIMINABLE response,

Juan
messages.raw:

Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2003 9:50 AM

Dear Jacob,

This is a big change in our plans. I have given this new development a lot of thought, and I have good news and bad news for you, and bad news for your associates.

The good news is, I may be able to raise most of the required amount, perhaps the whole sum. My family owns some very valuable old paintings, including the only existing copy of the Mona Lisa, and I can probably borrow some money out of them.

The bad news for us is, I will have to travel to Elbonia to make the arrangements, and this will delay our business for a couple of weeks. I need to find a suitable investor, contact the Louvre and tell them the bad news, and go to Amsterdam from there.

Tha bad news for your partners is: this will cost money. Since I am now financing the operation, I will expect a higher part of the funds. I require my participation to increase to 40%. Discuss this with them.

Please let me know your decision as soon as possible. According to the consulate, my passport has already been sent back, and I should receive it on Monday. If you agree to my conditions, I will start making travel arrangements right away.

Looking forward to your SUBLIMINABLE response,

Juan

messages.body:
Dear Jacob,

First, you have impressed me, which is not easy.  I
did not realize you were pulling this off all by
yourself, I thought the people from the CBN were on
the business.  Congratulations.

I am not an unreasonable man, but I always get a
reasonable return for risking my money or, like in
this case, some valuable family heirlooms.  My
relatives would be very disappointed if I lost the
Mona Lisa, which has been in the family for many
generations.

I probably should not do this, but I like you.  As a
show of good faith, I am lowering my requirement to
35% of the proceedings.  This is not negotiable:  take
it or leave it.  I live in a comfortable retirement
right now, and will only go into a new venture if I
think the reward is worthwhile.  That is my final word
about it.  Since you are the only other party
involved, the decision is entirely yours.

I am ready to travel.  Let me know if you are in, so I
can proceed in the most SUBLIMINABLE way.

Regards,

Juan

I have some good news: there are at least four people interested in buying. I have set a meeting for Monday morning, and I expect to travel to Amsterdam shortly thereafter. Apparently, there is a great deal of interest in authentic Leonardo paintings. I wonder how much I can get for the Sistine Chapel.

Looking through our past emails, I noticed that you never sent me any of the documentation you promised. Please do so at your earliest convenience, I'd rather not be in a hurry when I am already with the securities company.

Again, stay safe out there and keep a SUBLIMINABLE profile.

Juan
